intro: Atractylis conformis, commonly known as the common centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. Atractylis conformis is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
